description: From hodiern (“of this day, present-day”) +‎ -al (suffix forming adjectives). Hodiern is derived from Latin hodiernus (“of today, today’s; present, present-day; actual”), from hodiē (“today”) (from hōc (“this (thing)”) + diē (“day”) (ultimately Proto-Indo-European *dyew- (“to be bright; heaven, sky”))) + -rnus (suffix forming adjectives).

entries.meaning: (archaic or literary, rare outside grammar) Of or pertaining to the present day or today; hodiern.
